The cuts may increase banks' borrowing costs and force them to post more collateral in derivatives trades  weighing on

column4: Emerging market stock funds have $4.7 billion outflow: BofA
column5: NEW YORK Investors worldwide withdrew large sums of cash from emerging market funds in the latest week on lingering uncertainty over the U.S. Federal Reserve's plans for unwinding its bond-buying  data from a Bank of America Merrill Lynch Global Research report showed on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-PGE says Shangai Electric placed lowest bid for its Polish power plant

column4: U.S. FDA says new cholesterol drugs may not need outcome studies
column5: Nov 14 Members of an experimental class of cholesterol-lowering drugs could get U.S. regulatory approval based on their ability to  lower "bad" cholesterol  and may not need to show that they reduce the risk of heart attack and stroke  the Food and Drug Administration said on Thursday.
